raw_text:
Reyes tricked into Real admission
 
 Jose Antonio Reyes has added to speculation linking him with a move from Arsenal to Real Madrid after falling victim to a radio prank.
 
 The Spaniard believed he was talking to Real Madrid sporting director Emilio Butragueno when he allegedly berated his team-mates as "bad people". "I wish I was playing for Real Madrid," the 21-year-old told Cadena Cope. "Hopefully it could happen. I love the way Madrid play. I'm not happy with the way things are." The striker joined the Gunners from Seville for £17m at the start of 2004, but it has frequently been reported that he is homesick. He began the season in superb form but has struggled to maintain his high standards as Arsenal have gradually lost the Premiership initiative to Manchester United and Chelsea. "If I'm not (playing for Real) I'm going to have to carry on playing with some bad people," he added.
 
 "I'm sure there are none in the Real dressing room. "I'm happy Madrid is interested in me because it has always been my dream since I was little to play there." Before the story surfaced, Reyes had moved to play down reports linking him with the Spanish giants, issuing a statement through Arsenal describing the speculation as "flattering". "I have seen the stories in the media linking me with Real Madrid," he had said on Thursday lunchtime. "But not only am I under contract at Arsenal, I am happy here and committed to helping the team win more trophies." Butragueno, meanwhile, was angry at being impersonated by the radio disc jockey. "It is a disgrace, there is no foundation to this," he said. "He is an Arsenal player and we have to be respectful. We have to be careful because of the rumours that appear in the news."
llama3.2:1b: Jose Antonio Reyes has expressed his desire to join Real Madrid after falling victim to a radio prank, saying he wishes to play for them and would carry on playing with "bad people" if they don't make him their first choice. The 21-year-old joined Arsenal from Seville in 2004 but has struggled since to maintain his high standards at the club. Reyes had previously denied links with Real Madrid, describing the speculation as flattering.
llama3.2:3b: Jose Antonio Reyes was tricked into thinking he was talking to Real Madrid sporting director Emilio Butragueno, where he expressed interest in joining the club after being homesick at Arsenal.
gemma2:2b: Jose Antonio Reyes made a statement on Cadena Cope expressing his desire to play for Real Madrid and calling his Arsenal team-mates "bad people." The 21-year-old was tricked into believing he was talking with Real Madrid sporting director Emilio Butragueno. While Reyes denied the links between him and Real Madrid, Butragueno expressed displeasure over being impersonated and stated there is no foundation for the rumors.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Reyes played down reports linking him with Real Madrid after falling victim to a radio prank.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Reyes, who joined Arsenal from Sevilla for £17m, claims he was tricked into talking to Real Madrid's Emilio Butragueno on a radio show about being "bad people" at the club. Reyes, 21, says he would have played for Real Madrid if it were true and is committed to Arsenal despite reports linking him with Real. Real president but regrettable said there are no bad people in their dressing room and wants to know what was wrong with his impersonation of Emilio Butragueno on the radio.
qwen2.5:3b: Jose Antonio Reyes reportedly expressed interest in joining Real Madrid after a radio prank where he spoke negatively about his team-mates at Arsenal, expressing his admiration for Real's playing style. The incident has reignited speculation about Reyes' potential transfer from Arsenal to Real Madrid. Despite earlier denials, the striker later confirmed media reports linking him with both clubs. Meanwhile, Real Madrid's sporting director Emilio Butragueno expressed anger over being impersonated in the prank. Reyes joined Arsenal for £17m in 2004 but has struggled with recent form, and he indicated his long-held dream is to play for Real Madrid.
opencoder:1.5b: The Spaniard believes he was talking to Real Madrid sporting director Emilio Butragueno when he allegedly berated his team-mates as bad people. "Hopefully it could happen," Reyes told Cadena Cope, saying that he was playing for Real Madrid and there were reports suggesting he might have gone to see some bad people. After hearing the story, Reyes became more comfortable with the situation and decided to play for Real Madrid instead of trying to keep himself away from the press.

"I'm sure there are none in the Real dressing room." He is happy Madrid is interested in him because it has always been his dream since he was little to play there. deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, I need to summarize the given text. Let me read through it carefully.

The main points are about Jose Antonio Reyes joining Real Madrid after a radio prank. He was initially spotted as being from Arsenal but now thinks he might have been there. The story mentions his performance and why he thought he should be at Real Madrid instead of Manchester United. He said it's because he's not happy with Manchester United, so he wants to stay at Real Madrid. He also had a story about the rumors linking him to Real Madrid.

I need to make sure I capture all these elements in a concise summary without adding any explanations or extra information.
</think>

Jose Antonio Reyes has been linked with joining Real Madrid after a radio prank, though he initially thought it was from Arsenal. The 21-year-old striker joined the Gunners from Seville for £17m at the start of 2004 but has struggled since Manchester United took over in the Premiership due to their league victory. He expressed frustration with Manchester United's performance and hopes they improve, despite his poor form. However, he is now convinced it was a flattery from claims linking him to Real Madrid. Meanwhile, Emilio Butragueno, acting as a disc jockey, criticized the prank, calling it disrespectful and raising rumors that may be true.
tinyllama:1.1b: Jose Antonio Reyes has added to speculation linking him with a move from Arsenal to Real Madrid after falling victim to a radio prankster, allegedly berating his teammates as "bad people". The 21-year-old Arsenal striker confessed that he hoped to be playing for the Real Madrid side and was homesick, according to reports. However, Reyes denied having any plans to join the Spanish giants. He also claimed that there were no bad players in the Gunners dressing room. The Spanish international had previously addressed the rumours linking him with the La Liga heavyweights, releasing a statement through Arsenal denying the speculation. However, Arsenal's sporting director Emiliano Butragueno was not convinced of his player's commitment to the club and has reportedly issued a statement that he "doesn't see him" as an Arsenal player. The Spanish international is still under contract with the north London side, but Butragueno insisted that he needs to play more for the team to help them win more trophies.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Jose Antonio Reyes, a 21-year-old Spanish striker, claimed on Cadena Cope that he believed he was talking to Real Madrid's sporting director Emilio Butragueno when he berated his teammates and claimed he was homesick. However, he later clarified that he had been mistaken and admits he may have been playing for a rival team. Reyes joined Arsenal from Seville in 2004 for £17 million and has struggled to maintain his high standards this season. Should he be allowed to join Real Madrid, it would not only provide him with the opportunity to play for an elite club but could also boost his confidence and performance as a player.

However, he dismissed reports linking him with Real Madrid as a prank and issued a statement expressing his loyalty to Arsenal. Butragueno was upset by the impersonation, calling it "disgraceful" and emphasizing the importance of respect for players' contracts.

Butragueno was angry about being impersonated and warned that there is no foundation to the rumours linking him with Arsenal.
